Phenomenal Evil Power.name: Phenomenal Evil Power
Phenomenal Evil Power.blurb: Veigar is the greatest Evil to ever strike at the hearts of Runeterra - and he's only getting bigger! Striking an enemy Champion with a spell or scoring a takedown grants Veigar permanently increased Ability Power.
Phenomenal Evil Power.description: Innate: Veigar gains a stack of  Phenomenal Evil whenever he hits an enemy champion with an ability, and 5 stacks whenever he scores a champion  takedown.
Phenomenal Evil Power.description2: Veigar gains 1 ability power for every stack of  Phenomenal Evil.
Phenomenal Evil Power.notes:
* Stacks are gained for landing the ability, not dealing damage, and so is triggered by  Event Horizon and even versus spell-immune or magic-shielded targets.
 The two effects stack, granting 6 stacks for each enemy champion takedowned by an ability, 7 with  Baleful Strike.

Baleful Strike.name: Baleful Strike
Baleful Strike.blurb: Veigar unleashes a bolt of dark energy that deals magic damage to the first two enemies hit. Units killed by this bolt grant Veigar some ability power permanently.
Baleful Strike.description: Passive: Killing a unit with Baleful Strike grants 1 stack of  Phenomenal Evil, doubled against large minions and monsters.
Baleful Strike.description2: Active: Veigar unleashes a bolt of dark energy in the target direction, dealing  magic damage to the first two enemies hit.
Baleful Strike.notes:
* Killing two enemy champions with Baleful Strike grants +14 AP.
 Champion decoys (such as  LeBlanc's  Mirror Image) do not count as "champions", but are considered "units" and thus grant +1 AP.
 Units killed by  Luden's Echo's passive bolts can not grant extra ability power.

Dark Matter.name: Dark Matter
Dark Matter.blurb: Veigar calls a great mass of dark matter to fall from the sky to the target location, dealing magic damage when it lands. Stacks of Phenomenal Evil reduce Dark Matter's cooldown.
Dark Matter.description: Active: Veigar calls a mass of dark matter to fall from the sky which lands after a 1.25 second delay to the target location, dealing magic damage to all enemies hit.
Dark Matter.description2: Dark Matter's  cooldown is reduced by a percentage, scaling with  Phenomenal Evil.
Dark Matter.notes: * Dark Matter grants a short instance of  sight around its cast location.

Event Horizon.name: Event Horizon
Event Horizon.blurb: After a brief delay Veigar twists the edges of space around the target location for 3 seconds, stunning enemies who pass through the perimeter.
Event Horizon.description: Active: Veigar forms a cage around the target location which materializes after a 0.5 second delay and lasts for 3 seconds,  knocking down and  stunning all enemies who pass through its edges for the first time.
Event Horizon.notes:
* Event Horizon can only  stun a unit once per cast. A unit will not be  stunned twice if they walk through the perimeter again after recovering from an initial  stun.
 A champion that spell shields the stun will be immune to it even if they walk through the perimeter again.
  Glory in Death allows an Event Horizon to stun Sion twice.

  Blinks and  untargetabilities (i.e  Kassadin's  Riftwalk,  Fizz's  Playful) are not stopped by Event Horizon.
 Forced movement of a unit by  knockbacks or  pulls such as  Rocket Grab through Event Horizon's perimeter will be stopped.

Primordial Burst.name: Primordial Burst
Primordial Burst.blurb: Blasts target enemy champion, dealing a large amount of magic damage, increasing based on the target's missing health.
Primordial Burst.description: Active: Veigar blasts the target enemy champion with primordial energy, dealing magic damage to them, increased by 0% − 100% (based on target's missing health).
